rulings.ruling: You must give your opponent a reasonable amount of time to say Brilliant. If you go too fast, your opponent can ask you to wait.
No matter how many Spells you play and how many times your opponent forgets to say Brilliant, they will only take 3 damage at the end of the turn.
If your opponent is physically unable to comply with the directions, they do not need to speak, and will not take damage.

rulings.ruling: If the chosen player has 0 cards in their hand, they still shuffle their deck and then draw 4 cards.

name: Dementor's Kiss
effect: When you play this card, choose a Character in play and put it under this card. Cards that share Uniqueness with the chosen card cannot be played.  If this card would leave play, you may instead discard 3 cards from your hand.

rulings.ruling: If a card is placed under a card, it is not considered to be in play, in a player's hand, in a deck, or in a discard pile.
You may choose your own card.

No Characters that share Uniqueness with the chosen Character may be played. (i.e,. if you choose Harry the Seeker, no variations of Harry may be played.) See our Uniqueness Chart for a full list of affected cards.

name: Derrick and Bole

reward: You discard your hand. During your next turn, you may not play Adventures.

The Adventure is considered solved at the end of your opponents turn, and it triggers along with other At the end of your turn... effects.

name: Wormtail
effect: Play this card only if you have at least 5 Lessons in play.  Once per game, you may choose an Event in play and discard it, then do damage to an opponent equal to that card's printed Power cost.

If you choose an Event, and the Event is not discarded, you will still deal damage to an opponent.

rulings.ruling: Adventures, Characters, and Lessons have no printed Power cost, and thus cannot be chosen for this card.

name: Battered Old Suitcase

rulings.ruling: If there are not 3 cards under this card, then you must put a card under Battered Old Suitcase whenever you discard 1 or more cards. You may choose the card if you discard more than 1. This can trigger more than once a turn, during any players turn.
If you have more Battered Old Suitcases with less than 3 cards under it than the amount of cards you discard, the turn player will choose which Battered Old Suitcase(s) the card(s) will go under.

name: Beater's Retribution

effect: Put a non-Healing Spell from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Confiscated Map

rulings.ruling: If you have 3 Power in play, you will discard 4 cards from your hand. If you have 4 Power in play, you may discard 3 or 4 cards from your hand. If you have 5 Power in play, you may discard 2, 3, or 4 cards from your hand. If you have 6 Power, you may discard 1, 2, 3, or 4 cards from your hand. If you have at least 7 Power, you may discard up to 4 cards from your hand.
You may still discard more cards from your hand than required, up to 4.

reward: Your opponent may search their deck for a Lesson, reveal it, and put it into play, then shuffle their deck.

name: Death Warrant
effect: When you play this card, name a non-Lesson card. Whenever an opponent uses an Action to play the named card, they take 10 damage.

rulings.ruling: If your opponent plays the named card, their card entirely finishes resolving before Death Warrants effect resolves.
If Death Warrant is discarded before your opponents card finishes resolving, Deaths Warrants effect still occurs.

name: Dementor Swarm
flavorText: He could feel them watching him, hear their rattling breath like an evil wind around him.
effect: To play this card, discard 1 of your [F] Lessons from play. Whenever an opponent plays a Character, they cannot use Actions or activate abilities until the end of their turn.

rulings.ruling: If the played Characters has a When you play this card effect, it still occurs, as this is a triggered ability, not an activated ability. Likewise, any effects that would trigger because of playing the card will still trigger.

name: Dementors on the Lake
effect: When you play this card, if you have at least 4 Lessons in play, you get 1 more Action this turn.

to solve: Your opponent lets you choose 3 of their cards in play. Return them to their owner's hand.
reward: Your opponent may draw a card.
toSolve: Your opponent lets you choose 3 of their cards in play. Return them to their owner's hand.
reward: Your opponent may draw a card.

rulings.ruling: The effect does not reduce the number of Actions required to play the card. This card gives you a third Action after playing it.

name: Empty Classroom

effect: Locations need 3 more Power to play.
note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or an opponent's).

name: Exploding Charm

rulings.ruling: The card counts the amount of Charms Power you have from all sources, including but not limited to Lessons, Items, and Characters.

name: Fire Omens

effect: Choose an Item in play. Draw cards equal to the chosen Item's printed Power cost. Then each other player draws cards equal to the chosen Item's printed Power cost.

name: Full Moon

effect: If you have at least 5 Lessons in play, whenever 1 of your Creatures does damage, it does 1 more damage.

rulings.ruling: Full Moon will increase the damage that your Creatures do to all players and Creatures, not just an opponent.

name: Hermione's Secret
flavorText: Its called a Time-Turner, Hermione whispered, and I got it from Professor McGonagall on our first day back.
effect: You may reveal any number of cards from your hand. For each card type revealed, do 2 damage to an opponent.

rulings.ruling: You do not need to reveal your entire hand, more than 1 card of each card type, nor every card type you have. You may reveal 0 or any number of the card types you have in your hand.

name: Immaculate Concoction

name: Incorrect Interpretations

effect: Whenever cards are put in an opponent's deck (even if they were already in the deck), do 2 damage to them.

rulings.ruling: Incorrect Interpretations triggers on either players turn, and can trigger for multiple reasons (e.g. looking at the top card of their deck and putting them back on top and/or bottom, putting cards on the bottom of their deck, etc.).
Shuffling does not trigger Incorrect Interpretations.

name: Marauder Shenanigans
effect: Before each of your turns, if there is an Event in play, do 5 damage to your opponent.
to solve: Your opponent lets you search your deck. You may take up to 2 Events from your deck, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.
reward: Your opponent may put up to 2 Lessons from their discard pile into their hand.
toSolve: Your opponent lets you search your deck. You may take up to 2 Events from your deck, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.
reward: Your opponent may put up to 2 Lessons from their discard pile into their hand.

rulings.ruling: The Event in play can be your Event or an opponents.

name: Moonlit Transformation
effect: Choose 1 of your Wizards or Witches in play and discard it, then put a Creature from your hand into play. (You must still pay any additional costs to play the Creature.) That Creature does damage to an opponent.

rulings.ruling: You do not need to meet the Power requirements to play the card, but you must pay any additional costs (i.e. When you play this card effects).

name: Pumpkin Patch
effect: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play.  Whenever a player would take damage, they may instead let 1 of their Creatures take that damage.

name: Star Charts
effect: If this card is discarded from your hand, you may draw a card.  Do 2 damage to an opponent. Then, if that opponent has any cards in play, they choose 1 of them and return it to its owner's hand.

name: The Marauder's Legacy
effect: Your Marauder cards need 3 less Power and 1 less Action to play. (You still need at least 1 Power that matches. If this means you would use fewer than 1 Action, you still use 1 Action.)

name: Time Travel Hijinks
effect: Play this card only if you have at least 4 Lessons in play.

Before each of your opponent's turns, they choose a card they control with the highest printed Power cost and place it under this card. When this card leaves play, return all cards under this card to their owners' hands.
to solve: Your opponent discards 3 cards from their hand that share a Lesson type with a card under this card.
reward: Your opponent may draw 3 cards or do 3 damage to you.
toSolve: Your opponent discards 3 cards from their hand that share a Lesson type with a card under this card.
reward: Your opponent may draw 3 cards or do 3 damage to you.

name: Trelawney's Prediction
effect: Choose a card type that an opponent has in play. Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal a card of the chosen card type, then discard all revealed cards. That opponent reveals cards from the top of their deck until they reveal a card of the chosen card type, then they discard all revealed cards.

name: Victory Party
effect: You may play this card without using an Action if you have won a Match this turn. You get 2 more Actions this turn. You may only play 1 Victory Party each turn.

rulings.ruling: If you have won a Match this turn, you may play Victory Party even if there is an effect that does not allow you to use Actions to play Spells.

name: Biased Referee
effect: Whenever your opponent makes progress towards winning a Match, increase your progress by half that amount, rounded up. (If both players would win the match, your opponent is the winner.)

rulings.ruling: Increasing or decreasing progress means that your count toward winning the Match increases or decreases (damage, cards discarded, damage prevented, etc.). This does not mean that you do damage to your opponent, discard cards, or prevent damage.
Your progress advances after the effect that increased an opponents progress is fully resolved.

name: Blood Pops
flavorText: Ugh, no, Harry wont want one of those, theyre for vampires, I expect.  Hermione Granger
effect: Discard the top card of your deck. If it shares a card type with a card an opponent has in play, you may choose 1 of those cards and discard it. Then draw a card.

name: Cancelled Match
flavorText: Were not playing Slytherin! he told them, looking very angry. Flints just been to see me.
effect: Choose up to 2 Beaters, Chasers, Keepers, and/or Seekers in play and return them to their owners' hands.

name: Caught by Dementors
flavorText: ... a pair of strong, clammy hands suddenly attached themselves around Harrys neck.
effect: Choose a non-Lesson card type. During your opponent's next turn, they cannot play cards of the chosen type.

rulings.ruling: Your opponent also may not put into play any cards of the chosen card type.

name: Chilling Fog
flavorText: And then the thing beneath the hood, whatever it was, drew a long, slow, rattling breath, as though it were trying to suck something more than air from its surroundings.
effect: Do 1 damage to each Creature in play (even your own).

name: Cho's Comet
effect: If this card is discarded from play, put it into its owner's hand.

name: Crookshanks' Aid
effect: You may put a non-Healing Marauder card from your discard pile into your hand. Until the end of the turn, your Marauder cards do not require Power that matches to play.

name: Crystal Ball
effect: You may use an Action to draw 3 cards, then put 2 cards from your hand on top of your deck in any order.

name: Determined Training
flavorText: Full of determination, the team started training sessions, three evenings a week.
effect: Discard any number of cards from your hand. Draw that many cards plus 1.

name: Disarming Snape
flavorText: We attacked a teacher. ... We attacked a teacher ... , Hermione whimpered, staring at the lifeless Snape with frightened eyes.
effect: Do 6 damage to an opponent or choose a Character in play and discard it.

name: Dizzying Workload
flavorText: She was usually last to leave the common room at night, first to arrive at the library the next morning ...
effect: Count the number of Lessons in your discard pile. Until the end of your turn, your cards needs that much less Power to play. (You still need at least 1 Power that matches.)

rulings.ruling: If more Lessons enter your discard pile after you play this card, the Power cost reduction will not change.

name: Double-Ended Newt
effect: Whenever this card does damage to an opponent, you may choose a Creature in play. Do 1 damage to it.

name: Dropping Divination
flavorText: Oooooo, Professor Trelawney, Ive just remembered! You saw her leaving, didnt you?  Lavender Brown
effect: Choose an opponent's card in play and return it to its owner's hand. If you have at least 3 [T] Lessons in your discard pile, instead shuffle it into its owner's deck.

name: Empty Frame
flavorText: He nodded toward an empty classroom to the left of the one-eyed statue. Harry followed Fred and George inside.
effect: When you play this card, name a Character card. Cards that share Uniqueness with the named card cannot be played. You may use 2 Actions and discard this card from play to search your deck. You may take the named card from your deck and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.

rulings.ruling: Refer to the official Uniqueness Chart for a full list of affected Characters.
If the named Character is already in play, its owner may still use its abilities.
If there is already a version of the named Character in play, you cannot put a Character from your deck into play.

name: Executioner's Axe
effect: Whenever a Creature is discarded from play, you may do 2 damage to an opponent or draw a card.

name: Ferula
effect: Shuffle up to 3 non-Healing cards from your discard pile into your deck. If you have at least 3 [P] Lessons in your discard pile, instead shuffle up to 8 non-Healing cards from your discard pile into your deck.

name: Glacius
effect: Do 4 damage to an opponent. If you have at least 3 [C] Lessons in your discard pile, instead do 6 damage to an opponent and draw a card.

name: Hinkypunk
flavorText: Lures travellers into bogs. You notice the lantern dangling from his hand? Hops ahead  people follow the light ...  Professor Remus Lupin
effect: To play this card, discard 1 of your [F] Lessons from play. Whenever an opponent uses an Action to play a Lesson, do 2 damage to them.

name: Hippogriff
flavorText: They had the bodies, hind legs, and tails of horses, but the front legs, wings, and heads of what seemed to be giant eagles ...
effect: When you play this card, you may put up to 3 damage counters on it. If you do, do that much damage divided as you choose among any number of creatures.

rulings.ruling: If a card reduces damage per card (such as Madam Malkins Robes) then it will decrease the overall damage done by this card by 1; it will not decrease each instance of damage.

Hippogriffs effect of placing damage counters on itself does not do damage to itself. Effects that would increase damage Creatures do will not increase the number of damage counters placed on Hippogriff, and damage counters can be placed on Hippogriff even if an effect would prevent damage dealt to Creatures.

name: Hurling Hex
flavorText: Can't nothing interfere with a broomstick except powerful Dark magic ...  Rubeus Hagrid
effect: Do 4 damage to your opponent. You may also choose a Creature in play and do 4 damage to it.

name: Inter-House Final
flavorText: They walked out onto the field to a tidal wave of noise.
effect: to win: Whenever a player takes damage, they may discard any number of cards from their hand. They prevent that much damage.  To win: Prevent 8 damage.
prize: The winner may draw 2 cards. The loser takes 8 damage.
toWin: Whenever a player takes damage, they may discard any number of cards from their hand. They prevent that much damage.  To win: Prevent 8 damage.
prize: The winner may draw 2 cards. The loser takes 8 damage.

rulings.ruling: Damage prevention doesnt need to be from the Matchs effect.
You may discard any number of cards; you do not need to discard the same number of cards as the damage you are taking.
Once a Match is won, its effects cannot be used. Neither player may continue to use the Matchs effect to prevent damage.

name: Lupin's Resignation
flavorText: This time tomorrow, the owls will start arriving from parents. . . . They will not want a werewolf teaching their children, Harry.  Professor Remus Lupin
effect: If at least 1 of your Creatures dealt damage to an opponent this turn, choose a non-Healing Character in play and shuffle it into its owner's deck.

name: Marking the Seeker
flavorText: ... he glanced around, saw Malfoy on his tail ...'
effect: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck, then put them on the top and/or bottom of your deck in any order. If you have at least 3 [Q] Lessons in your discard pile, draw 2 cards.

name: Nox
effect: Choose two of the following, then shuffle this card into your deck:  Look at the top 2 cards of an opponent's deck, then put them back in any order.  Prevent the next 1 damage you would take on an opponent's next turn.  An opponent discards a card from their hand.

rulings.ruling: You cannot choose the same option twice.
You must complete both chosen options before shuffling this card back into your deck.

name: Patronus Practice
effect: Choose an opponent's card in play. They may discard the card from play. If they don't, draw 2 cards and you get 1 more Action this turn.

name: Pocket Sneakoscope
effect: All opponents reveal any cards they draw during their draw step.

name: Pressing the Knot
flavorText: He slithered between the battering branches like a snake and placed his front paws upon a knot on the trunk.
effect: Do 4 damage to an opponent. During that opponent's next turn, they can't use Actions to play Creatures.

name: Red Sparks
effect: Choose an opponent's Creature in play and do 3 damage to it. If you have any cards in hand, choose and discard 1 of them.

name: Scabbers' Disappearance
flavorText: BLOOD! Ron yelled into the stunned silence. HES GONE!
effect: Once during each of your turns, whenever 1 of your Creatures does damage to an opponent, you may discard it from play. If you do, do 4 damage to that opponent.

name: Scabbers' Return
flavorText: Its okay, Scabbers! said Ron. No cats! Theres nothing here to hurt you!
effect: You may put a Creature from your discard pile into your hand. If you have at least 3 [F] Lessons in your discard pile, you may play that Creature without using an Action.

rulings.ruling: You must pay any additional costs (e.g., To play this card).

name: Sirius's Letter
effect: Whenever you search your deck, you may draw a card.

name: Wizard's Desk
effect: During your turn, you may discard this card from play. If you do, draw cards equal to the number of cards you discarded from your hand this turn or any opponents' last turn.

name: Ancient Runes, Third Year
effect: Before your turn, discard this card from play. If you do, you may search your deck for a [F] or [T] Lesson and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.

rulings.ruling: These Lessons have no Lesson type. Cards like Hermione, Potion Maker cannot use their ability to play one of these since they have no Lesson type.
Unlike other Lessons, these Lessons have a Keyword: Advanced.

If multiple of these are in play before your turn, each of them will trigger. This is not a may ability. You must discard the Lesson, but you may choose to not search your deck for a Lesson and put it into play. If you do not search your deck, you will not shuffle your deck.
You may only have 4 of each of these Lessons in your deck since these are named cards and not generic Lessons.

name: Arithmancy, Third Year
effect: Before your turn, discard this card from play. If you do, you may search your deck for a [C] or [Q] Lesson and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.

name: Herbology, Third Year
effect: Before your turn, discard this card from play. If you do, you may search your deck for a [F] or [P] Lesson and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.

rulings.ruling: These Lessons have no Lesson type. Cards like Hermione, Potion Maker cannot use their ability to play one of these since they have no Lesson type.
Unlike other Lessons, these Lessons have a Keyword: Advanced.

If multiple of these are in play before your turn, each of them will trigger. This is not a may ability. You must discard the Lesson, but you may choose to not search your deck for a Lesson and put it into play. If you do not search your deck, you will not shuffle your deck.
You may only have 4 of each of these Lessons in your deck since these are named cards and not generic Lessons.

name: History of Magic, Third Year
effect: Before your turn, discard this card from play. If you do, you may search your deck for a [C] or [T] Lesson and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.

rulings.ruling: These Lessons have no Lesson type. Cards like Hermione, Potion Maker cannot use their ability to play one of these since they have no Lesson type.
Unlike other Lessons, these Lessons have a Keyword: Advanced.

If multiple of these are in play before your turn, each of them will trigger. This is not a may ability. You must discard the Lesson, but you may choose to not search your deck for a Lesson and put it into play. If you do not search your deck, you will not shuffle your deck.
You may only have 4 of each of these Lessons in your deck since these are named cards and not generic Lessons.

name: Muggle Studies, Third Year
effect: Before your turn, discard this card from play. If you do, you may search your deck for a [P] or [Q] Lesson and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.

rulings.ruling: These Lessons have no Lesson type. Cards like Hermione, Potion Maker cannot use their ability to play one of these since they have no Lesson type.
Unlike other Lessons, these Lessons have a Keyword: Advanced.

If multiple of these are in play before your turn, each of them will trigger. This is not a may ability. You must discard the Lesson, but you may choose to not search your deck for a Lesson and put it into play. If you do not search your deck, you will not shuffle your deck.
You may only have 4 of each of these Lessons in your deck since these are named cards and not generic Lessons.

name: Alicia Spinnet
flavorText: '... A penalty to Gryffindor, taken by Spinnet, who puts it away, no trouble ...'  Lee Jordan, commentator
effect: If there is a Match in play, whenever 1 of your cards that needs Quidditch Power does damage, it does 1 more damage.

rulings.ruling: Whenever you play a Quidditch card that does damage, Alicia will trigger to check if a Match is in play, and if so - regardless of when you played the Match - will give your Quidditch card +1 damage.

When you win a Match, you resolve its effect before discarding it from play. This means if the Matchs prize does damage, Alicia will see that it is still in play and give the Match +1 damage (unless the Match is discarded by another card first).

name: Aragog
flavorText: 'A traveler gave me to Hagrid when I was an egg. Hagrid was only a boy, but he cared for me ...'  Aragog
effect: To play this card, discard 1 of your Care of Magical Creatures Lessons from play. Whenever another of your Spiders does damage, it does 2 more damage.

name: Armando Dippet
effect: At the end of each of your turns, if you played a Gryffindor, Hufflepuff, Ravenclaw, or Slytherin card, you may draw a card or do 2 damage to an opponent.

rulings.ruling: Armando only triggers once each turn, and only at the end of your turn, regardless of how many House cards you play.

name: Cancelled Exams
flavorText: '... the exams had been canceled as a school treat ...'
effect: Choose an opponent. On their next turn, they gain 1 more Action. On your next turn, you gain 2 more Actions.

name: Chamber of Secrets
note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's).
flavorText: 'Naturally, the school has been searched for evidence of such a chamber ... It does not exist.'  Professor Binns
effect: Cards cannot be played from or leave their owners' discard piles.

rulings.ruling: No card in the discard pile may leave the discard pile, be played from the discard pile, or be chosen as a target by another card. Cards like Reparo, Remembrall, and Healing cards would not be able to be played/activated since you cannot complete everything on the card.

name: Dobby
flavorText: 'The little creature on the bed had large, bat-like ears and bulging green eyes the size of tennis balls.'
effect: During each opponent's turn, you may prevent up to 4 damage done to you. If any damage is prevented in this way, at the end of that turn, that opponent may choose a non-Healing card in play other than Dobby. Return that card to its owner's hand.

rulings.ruling: If Dobby is the only card in play (on either your or an opponents side) and you prevent any damage with Dobbys effect, your opponent has no legal targets to choose for Dobbys effect. You can still prevent damage with Dobby, but your opponent will get no benefit from Dobby.
An opponent choosing to return a card if you prevent damage with Dobby is optional. They can choose to return nothing.

name: Dobby is Free!
effect: Your opponent may use Actions only to draw or play cards.
to solve: Your opponent uses Actions to play cards 4 times.
reward: Your opponent may choose 1 of your Characters in play. Their starting Character gains the abilities of the chosen Character until the end of their turn.
toSolve: Your opponent uses Actions to play cards 4 times.
reward: Your opponent may choose 1 of your Characters in play. Their starting Character gains the abilities of the chosen Character until the end of their turn.

name: Drawing the Sword
flavorText: 'Only a true Gryffindor could have pulled that out of the hat, Harry.'  Albus Dumbledore
effect: Play this card only if you have a Gryffindor Witch or Wizard in play. Do 6 damage divided as you choose among any number of Creatures.

rulings.ruling: Damage done by Drawing the Sword occurs to each target once in the order you specify.
If a card reduces damage per card (such as Madam Malkins Robes) then it will decrease the overall damage done by this card by 1; it will not decrease each instance of damage.

name: Dueling Club
note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's).
flavorText: 'I wouldn't mind dueling lessons; they might come in handy one of these days ...'  Seamus Finnigan
effect: At the end of each player's turn, if that player used an Action to play a Spell, they draw a card.

name: Dumbledore's Suspension
note: Play this card only if you have at least 4 Lessons in play.
effect: Your opponent's starting Character loses all abilities (including any Lessons provided).
to solve: Your opponent skips a total of 3 Actions.
reward: The next Spell your opponent plays needs 2 less Power to play.
toSolve: Your opponent skips a total of 3 Actions.
reward: The next Spell your opponent plays needs 2 less Power to play.

rulings.ruling: A card that loses all abilities means that card retains its card type, name, and keywords but loses everything else (such as effects and Power provided). Creatures, however, retain health and damage per turn.

name: Immobulus
effect: Choose an opponent. During their next turn, prevent all damage done to you by their Creatures. Until the beginning of your next turn, if one of their Creatures takes damage, discard that Creature.

rulings.ruling: If an effect prevents damage done to Creatures (such as Frog-Spawn) any damage directed at protected Creatures will be prevented and Immobuluss second effect will not discard the Creature from play.

name: Katie Bell
flavorText: '... nice dive around Flint, up off the field ...'  Lee Jordan, commentator
effect: If there is a Match in play, whenever a card (yours or an opponent's) does damage to you, it does 1 less damage.

rulings.ruling: When you win a Match, you resolve its effect before discarding it from play. This means if the Matchs prize does damage, Katie will see that it is still in play and make the damage you take 1 less.

Katie checks for a Match in play for each instance of you taking damage, not at the beginning of your turn. If a Match is discarded from play and then you take damage, Katie will not reduce damage by 1.

name: Loyalty's Reward
effect: Choose 5 non-Healing cards, of different types, in your discard pile. Your opponent chooses 1 of those cards. Put that card on the bottom of your deck and the rest into your hand. (You must choose 5 cards.)

rulings.ruling: There are 9 card types: Adventure, Character, Creature, Event, Item, Lesson, Location, Match, and Spell.
If you dont have 5 cards of different card types in your discard pile, you cannot complete everything on Loyaltys Reward and so you cannot play it.

name: Lucius' Cane
effect: At the end of each of your turns, do 2 damage to your opponent for each Action you have used after the second Action. (If you play this card, and you already have a Wand in play, discard the old one.)

rulings.ruling: To see what "Using an Action" means, refer to the Official HPTCG Revival rules.

name: Lucius Malfoy
flavorText: 'The man ... could only be Draco's father. He had the same pale, pointed face and identical cold, gray eyes.'
effect: At the end of each of your turns, if you have used 5 or more Actions, you may search your deck, take any card, put it into your hand, and then shuffle your deck.

rulings.ruling: To see what "Using an Action" means, refer to the Official HPTCG Revival rules.
If a card prevents you from taking a card from your deck, you may not search your deck at all and will not shuffle your deck.

If you decide to search your deck with Lucius effect, you must take a card and complete the entire card effect. Luciuss may clause is a conditional for the entire effect unlike the other cards that search your deck, such as Gringotts Vault Key. With Lucius, you must either do his effect to completion or not do it at all.

name: Millicent Bulstrode
flavorText: 'She was large and square and her heavy jaw jutted aggressively.'
effect: Once per turn, you may use an Action to do 1 damage to an opponent's Creature.

name: Moaning Myrtle
effect: Once per game, you may choose an opponent's card in play. If the chosen card is discarded from play, do 8 damage to that opponent.

rulings.ruling: If the chosen card leaves play without being discarded (such as with Hover Charm), Myrtles effect will not trigger.
If Myrtle leaves play before the chosen card is discarded, no damage will be dealt when the card leaves play.

name: Muddled Memories
flavorText: 'I think I'm the one attacking everyone, Tom!'  Ginny Weasley
effect: Look at an opponent's hand. You may choose 1 of those cards. If you do, on their next turn, they must use their first Action(s) to play that card. (If your opponent cannot play that card, this ability has no effect.)

rulings.ruling: If you have Pep Talk in play and you play Muddled Memories, your opponent will decide whether they want to have Pep Talk or Muddled Memories occur first, since it is their turn. Whichever card they do not choose has no effect for that turn, as the first Action will be used by the other.

If you choose a card that requires more than 2 Actions to play, your opponent must use as many Actions as required to play that card, and must use the first available Actions to play that card, if they have enough Actions to play the card.

name: Polyjuice Potion
effect: To play this card, discard 1 of your Potions Lessons from play. Choose 1 of an opponent's Wizards or Witches in play. Your starting Character gains all abilities of that card until the end of your turn.

rulings.ruling: Gaining abilities means to take on any text in the text box other than flavor text, including activated and passive abilities, as well as Lessons provided, but does not take on keywords, card types, or card names.

name: Prof. Gilderoy Lockhart
flavorText: 'Fame's a fickle friend, Harry ... Celebrity is as celebrity does. Remember that.'  Professor Gilderoy Lockhart
effect: At the end of each player's turn, if you have discarded a card from your hand, choose an opponent. They discard a card from their hand.

rulings.ruling: No matter how many cards you discarded, Lockhart will only make an opponent discard 1 card.
Lockhart triggers at the end of all player's turns if you discarded a card that turn.

name: Slytherin's Basilisk
effect: To play this card, discard 2 of your Care of Magical Creatures Lessons from play. At the end of each of your turns, you may choose 1 of an opponent's Characters or Creatures in play and put a petrification counter on it. Cards with petrification counters lose all abilities and do no damage. When this card leaves play, remove all petrification counters from play.

rulings.ruling: A card that loses all abilities means that card retains its card type, name, and keywords but loses everything else (such as effects and Power provided). Creatures, however, retain health and damage per turn.
If Slytherins Basilisk loses its ability, then Petrification Counters dont have any effect. Petrification Counters will remain on cards, however, unless they are removed in some other way.

If Slytherins Basilisk loses its abilities (via something such as Vera Verto) and then leaves play, all Petrification Counters will remain on the field, though they will have no effect until another Slytherins Basilisk is played.
You may put multiple Petrification Counters on the same card. Multiple Petrification Counters will have no additional effect, but that card will now be super petrified.

name: Swallowed Snitch
effect: During your turn, if your hand contains at least 4 cards, you may discard this card from play. If you do, discard your hand to win the current Match.

rulings.ruling: You must discard all cards in your hand when you activate this cards effect, even if you have more than 4 cards in your hand.

name: Tom Marvolo Riddle
flavorText: 'Brilliant. Of course, he was probably the most brilliant student Hogwarts has ever seen.'  Albus Dumbledore
effect: Once during each of your turns, when you play a Lesson, you may choose a Lesson type. Until the end of your turn, this card provides 1 Power of the chosen type.

rulings.ruling: Toms ability only triggers when a Lesson is played, not when a card that provides Power is played. For example, Toms ability will not trigger with Borrowed Wand.
There are 5 Lesson types: Care of Magical Creatures, Charms, Potions, Quidditch, and Transfiguration.

Since there is no difference between playing a card and putting a card into play, if a card like History of Magic Homework puts a Lesson into play, Toms ability will trigger. However, no matter how many Lessons are put into play, such as with Strategy Session, Tom will only add 1 Power per turn.

name: Wandering Knockturn
note: Play this card only if you have at least 5 Lessons in play.
effect: After your opponent uses an Action to play a Creature or Item, they discard that card from play.
to solve: Your opponent discards 2 cards in this way.
reward: Your opponent may put up to 2 Lessons from their discard pile into play.
toSolve: Your opponent discards 2 cards in this way.
reward: Your opponent may put up to 2 Lessons from their discard pile into play.

rulings.ruling: Wandering Knockturn discards the card after it is played and enters the field, so any card that has an ability that triggers when it enters, such as Pewter Cauldron, will activate before Wandering Knockturn discards it.

name: Aragog's Lair
note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's).
flavorText: 'Aragog clicked his pincers furiously, and all around the hollow the sound was echoed by the crowd of spiders ...'
effect: Each Spider has 2 more Health (even your opponents').

name: Arania Exumai
flavorText: 'Even as he reached for his wand, Harry knew it was no good, there were too many of them ...'
effect: Do 2 damage to a Creature of your choice. Then do 3 damage to all Spider Creatures (even your own).

name: Basilisk Fang
effect: When you play this card, do 2 damage to your opponent or to a Creature of your choice. You may use an Action to discard this card from play. If you do, choose an opponent's Item in play and discard it.

name: Bowtruckle
flavorText: 'I just happen to have met several of these exotic plants on my travels ...'  Professor Gilderoy Lockhart
effect: When another of your Plants takes damage, this card deals 1 damage to an opponent of your choice.

name: Break with a Banshee
effect: During your turn, you may discard this card from play. If you do, choose a non-Healing Match with printed Power cost of 1 in your discard pile. Play it as if it were in your hand. (You must still use an Action to play the card.)

rulings.ruling: To discard a Lockhart book, you must have a valid card in your discard pile and be able to play that card. You must be able to do everything on the Lockhart Book and the chosen card to play the chosen card.
You use the Action to play the card you choose with the Book, not to discard the Book from play. This means the Action is playing the card rather than discarding the Book from play.
Since you are playing the card chosen by the Book, you must pay any additional cost.
If a card would increase the cost of a card beyond 2, you may still choose the card, as Lockharts Books look at the printed Power cost of the chosen card, not altered cost.

name: Circling the Goal Posts
effect: Do 3 damage to an opponent. Then draw a card. At the end of each of your turns, if this card is in your discard pile and a Spell did at least 5 damage to an opponent, you may discard a card from your hand to put this card into your hand.

name: Cornish Pixie
effect: When you play this card, look at an opponent's hand. You may choose a card and place it under this card. (Cards under this card cannot be interacted with.) When this card leaves play, return that card to its owner's hand.

rulings.ruling: If a card is placed under a card, it is not considered to be in play, in a player's hand, in a deck, or in a discard pile.
If Cornish Pixie loses its ability, the chosen card beneath it stays there. If Cornish Pixie leaves play while having no ability, the card will stay facedown for the rest of the game.
All players may look at the chosen card once it is beneath this card.

name: Deathday Party
effect: Whenever a card is discarded from play, your opponent says, 'Rest in peace.' If your opponent forgets, they take 3 damage at the end of the turn.
to solve: Your opponent chooses 3 Lessons in their hand and discards them.
reward: Your opponent may look at your hand. They may choose 1 of those cards and discard it.
toSolve: Your opponent chooses 3 Lessons in their hand and discards them.
reward: Your opponent may look at your hand. They may choose 1 of those cards and discard it.

rulings.ruling: You must give your opponent a reasonable amount of time to say Brilliant. If you go too fast, your opponent can ask you to wait.
If your opponent is physically unable to comply with the directions, they do not need to speak, and will not take damage.

name: Draco's Superiority
flavorText: 'Everyone's just been admiring the brooms my father's bought our team.'  Draco Malfoy
effect: Search your deck. You may take a Broom from your deck, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck. If that card's printed Power cost is at least 5, do 5 damage to an opponent.

name: Essential Knowledge Test
effect: Whenever you would draw a card, except during your draw step, you may choose not to.

rulings.ruling: Essential Knowledge Test allows you to either continue to draw the number of cards required or draw none. There is no inbetween.

With Essential Knowledge Test in play, you may still play cards that require you to draw. The draw effect may be prevented by Essential Knowledge Test, if you choose, but the effect will count as having happened.

name: Gadding with Ghouls
effect: During your turn, you may discard this card from play. If you do, choose a non-Healing Item with printed Power cost of 2 or less in your discard pile. Play it as if it were in your hand. (You must still use an Action to play the card.)

rulings.ruling: To discard a Lockhart book, you must have a valid card in your discard pile and be able to play that card. You must be able to do everything on the Lockhart Book and the chosen card to play the chosen card.
You use the Action to play the card you choose with the Book, not to discard the Book from play. This means the Action is playing the card rather than discarding the Book from play.
Since you are playing the card chosen by the Book, you must pay any additional cost.
If a card would increase the cost of a card beyond 2, you may still choose the card, as Lockharts Books look at the printed Power cost of the chosen card, not altered cost.

name: Hogwarts Pipes
note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's).
flavorText: 'But how's the basilisk been getting around the place?'  Ron Weasley
effect: When any player takes damage, they discard cards from the bottom of their deck instead of the top.

rulings.ruling: You still draw from the top of your deck while Hogwarts Pipes is in play, since drawing is not taking damage.
Hogwarts Pipes ability is not optional. Any damage taken must be taken from the bottom of your deck.

name: Holidays with Hags
effect: You may use an Action and discard this card from play. If you do, put up to 2 Lessons of the same type from your discard pile into play.

rulings.ruling: To discard a Lockhart book, you must have a valid card in your discard pile and be able to play that card. You must be able to do everything on the Lockhart Book and the chosen card to play the chosen card.
You use the Action to play the card you choose with the Book, not to discard the Book from play. This means the Action is playing the card rather than discarding the Book from play.
Since you are playing the card chosen by the Book, you must pay any additional cost.
If a card would increase the cost of a card beyond 2, you may still choose the card, as Lockharts Books look at the printed Power cost of the chosen card, not altered cost.

name: Kheshakhassa
effect: To play this card, discard 1 of your Potions Lessons from play. Search your deck. You may take a Location that needs Potions Power with printed Power cost 5 or less from your deck and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.

rulings.ruling: When you play a Location using Kheshakhassa, you will still discard any Location that is already in play, as you will need to follow the effect on the Location you play to discard any other Location in play (yours or an opponents).

If a card prevents you from playing Locations (such as Blocked Barrier), you may still activate Kheshakhassa since the activation and Action use is discarding a Potions Lesson and searching your deck, while playing a Location is a may that follows.

name: Lockhart's Office
note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's).
flavorText: 'Shining brightly on the walls by the light of many candles were countless framed photographs of Lockhart.'
effect: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard any number of cards from their hand.

name: Magical Me
effect: During your turn, you may discard this card from play. If you do, choose a non-Healing Spell with printed Power cost of 2 or less in your discard pile. Play it as if it were in your hand. (You must still use an Action to play the card.)

rulings.ruling: To discard a Lockhart book, you must have a valid card in your discard pile and be able to play that card. You must be able to do everything on the Lockhart Book and the chosen card to play the chosen card.
You use the Action to play the card you choose with the Book, not to discard the Book from play. This means the Action is playing the card rather than discarding the Book from play.
Since you are playing the card chosen by the Book, you must pay any additional cost.
If a card would increase the cost of a card beyond 2, you may still choose the card, as Lockharts Books look at the printed Power cost of the chosen card, not altered cost.

name: Mandrake Draught
effect: Choose 1 of your Characters in play that has a 'Once per turn' ability that you have already used this turn. Use that ability again without using any Actions.

rulings.ruling: Even if a card increases the number of Actions needed to use a Characters ability, Mandrake Draught will eliminate all need for Actions to use that ability.

name: Quidditch Plaque
effect: Whenever you play a Seeker, Beater, Keeper, or Chaser Character, you use up 1 Action to play it instead of 2. During your turn, you may discard this card from play. If you do, put a non-Healing Seeker, Beater, Keeper, or Chaser from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Skurge
effect: Choose 2 of your non-Healing cards in play of different card types (other than your starting Character). Discard 1 of them and return the other to your hand.

name: Spellotape
effect: If you would discard another Item from play due to an opponent's card, discard this card instead.

rulings.ruling: Spellotape only triggers when an opponents card effect would discard one of your Items from play. If your Item is returned to your hand, Spellotape does nothing.

If your opponent plays Scribblifors, you can choose an Item to discard and Spellotape to return to your hand. Do things in the order they are on the card. Since the discard happens first, Spellotape would be a replacement for the discarded Item, and would discard itself. The chosen Spellotape is no longer in play, so nothing is returned to your hand.

If a card such as Bundimun Ooze were to discard another of your Items from play and Spellotape replaces your Item and is discarded instead, Bundimun Ooze looks at the card that is discarded, not the initial target. This would mean you would use Spellotapes stats to resolve Bundimun Ooze. Similarly, if Spellotape replaces a Wand that Expelliarmus discards, Expelliarmus would look at Spellotapes keywords, since Spellotape is the card that was discarded.
If all Items are discarded from play by an opponent, such as with Table Trouble, then Spellotape will not trigger because it, too, will be discarded from play.
If Spellotape is in play and one of your Items would be discarded from play, you must discard Spellotape instead. This is not a may ability.
If you have multiple Spellotapes in play and another of your Items is discarded by an opponent, only 1 Spellotape will be discarded.

name: Vera Verto
effect: Choose a Creature in play. It becomes an Item that has no abilities, damage each turn, health, or keywords (except Unique) while it is in play.

rulings.ruling: The chosen Creature is treated as an Item with the same name, printed Power cost, Lesson type, and Uniqueness, but loses everything else, including damage per turn, health, and effects. If the card is somehow turned back into a Creature, it regains everything.
Vera Verto keeps the Uniqueness of what is played, meaning if a Hedwig or other Unique creature is chosen, another Hedwig or copy of that Unique Creature cannot be played.

name: Voyages with Vampires
effect: During your turn, you may discard this card from play. If you do, choose a Creature with printed Power cost 2 or less in your discard pile. Play it as if it were in your hand. (You must still use an Action to play the card.)

rulings.ruling: To discard a Lockhart book, you must have a valid card in your discard pile and be able to play that card. You must be able to do everything on the Lockhart Book and the chosen card to play the chosen card.
You use the Action to play the card you choose with the Book, not to discard the Book from play. This means the Action is playing the card rather than discarding the Book from play.
Since you are playing the card chosen by the Book, you must pay any additional cost.
If a card would increase the cost of a card beyond 2, you may still choose the card, as Lockharts Books look at the printed Power cost of the chosen card, not altered cost.

name: Whispers from the Pipes
effect: Before each of your opponent's turns, they reveal the top card of their deck. You may take 1 damage to put that card on the bottom of their deck.
to solve: Your opponent puts their hand on the bottom of their deck in any order.
reward: Your opponent names a card type. Reveal your hand and discard all cards of the chosen type.
toSolve: Your opponent puts their hand on the bottom of their deck in any order.
reward: Your opponent names a card type. Reveal your hand and discard all cards of the chosen type.

rulings.ruling: If you have a card that reduces the damage from Whispers from the Pipes to 0 (such as Madam Malkin's Robes), you can still do everything the card says since you took the damage (even though it was 0 damage).

name: Winter Match
flavorText: 'I haven't been properly dry since August'  George Weasley
effect: to win: Draw cards 7 times while this card is in play. (Drawing multiple cards at a time counts once.)
prize: The winner may put a card from their discard pile into their hand.
toWin: Draw cards 7 times while this card is in play. (Drawing multiple cards at a time counts once.)
prize: The winner may put a card from their discard pile into their hand.

rulings.ruling: Drawing the card during your draw step counts.
Healing cards may be returned to their owners hand from the discard pile with this effect.
No matter how many cards you draw at once, that draw will only count as 1 of the 7 instances of drawing you need.

name: Baby Acromantula
flavorText: '... I cannot deny them fresh meat, when it wanders so willingly into our midst.'  Aragog
effect: When you play this card, search your deck. You may take a Baby Acromantula from your deck, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.

name: Cauldron Calamity
effect: To play this card, discard any number of your Potions Lessons from play. For each Potions Lesson discarded, do 2 damage to an opponent or to a Creature of your choice. (You may choose the same target multiple times.)

rulings.ruling: If a card reduces damage per card (such as Madam Malkins Robes) then it will decrease the overall damage done by this card by 1; it will not decrease each instance of damage.
You may split the 2 damage per Potion Lesson discarded however you want, but you cannot split up 2 damage into 1 damage and 1 damage.
Cauldron Calamity does damage to each target you choose once, in the order you choose.

name: Colin's Camera
effect: Before each of your turns, draw a card. Then all your opponents draw a card.

name: Dodging the Bludger
flavorText: '... he looped and swooped, spiraled, zigzagged, and rolled ... avoiding another fierce dive from the Bludger.'
effect: Do 2 damage to an opponent. Then draw a card. You may put a Quidditch Lesson from your hand into play.

name: Dueling Practice
flavorText: ''I said disarm only!' Lockhart shouted in alarm over the heads of the battling crowd ...'
effect: Do 1 damage to an opponent. At the end of your turn, draw 2 cards.

name: Eat Slugs
flavorText: '... he gave an almighty belch and several slugs dribbled out of his mouth onto his lap.'
effect: Do 2 damage to yourself. Then draw a card.

name: Enemies of the Heir, Beware
effect: Choose an opponent and a card type. They reveal their hand, discard all cards of the chosen type, and take damage equal to the number of cards discarded in this way.

name: Expelliarmus
flavorText: 'There was a dazzling flash of scarlet light and Lockhart was blasted off his feet ...'
effect: Choose 1 of your opponent's Items in play and discard it. If that item was a Wand, during their next turn, they can't use Actions to play Spells.

name: Forest Spider
flavorText: 'Spiders the size of carthorses, eight-eyed, eight-legged, black, hairy, gigantic.'
effect: While this card is in your hand, it requires 1 less Power to play for each of your Spiders in play.

name: Mimblewimble
effect: Do 4 damage to an opponent. During their next turn, they can't use their first Action to play Spells.

rulings.ruling: Your opponent will be able to use any Action other than their first to play Spells. This means their second Action (if they have one) and any Action beyond that (if they gain more than 2 Actions) may be used to play Spells.

name: Mis-Brewed Polyjuice
effect: Count the number of Characters an opponent has in play and in their discard pile. Do that much damage to that opponent. Then, choose 1 of their Characters in play. Until their next turn, that Character loses all abilities.

rulings.ruling: A card that loses all abilities means that card retains its card type, name, and keywords but loses everything else (such as effects and Power provided). Creatures, however, retain health and damage per turn.

name: Mortal Enemies
flavorText: 'Fawkes was soaring around its head, and the basilisk was snapping furiously at him with fangs long and thin as sabers ...'
effect: Choose 1 of your Creatures in play and 1 of an opponent's Creatures in play. They do damage to each other.

rulings.ruling: Both Creatures do damage at the same time, and they deal damage only once.

name: New Slytherin Seeker
flavorText: ''All right there, Scarhead?' yelled Malfoy, shooting underneath him as though to show off the speed of his broom.'
effect: Do 5 damage to an opponent. If there is a Match in play, you may have that opponent choose 1 of their Creatures in play and discard it.

rulings.ruling: You may play New Slytherin Seeker even if there isnt a Match in play, but when the card checks for a Match, you will not be able to make your opponent discard one of their Creatures unless there is a Match in play.

name: Old Sock
flavorText: ''Got a sock,' said Dobby in disbelief. 'Master threw it, and Dobby caught it ...''
effect: When you play this card, draw a card.

name: Parseltongue
flavorText: 'A Parselmouth! You can talk to snakes!'  Ron Weasley
effect: Choose an opponent's Creature in play and return it to their hand. If you have Snake in play, discard your opponent's Creature instead.

name: Peskipiksi Pesternomi
flavorText: 'It had absolutely no effect; one of the pixies seized his wand and threw it out of the window, too.'
effect: Discard all Wands in play.

name: Petrifying Stare
flavorText: 'But no ones died  because no one looked it straight in the eye.'  Harry Potter
effect: Choose an opponent's Character (other than their starting Character) or non-Rooster Creature in play. Shuffle that card into their deck.

name: Pre-Match Handshake
flavorText: '... giving each other threatening stares and gripping rather harder than was necessary ...'
effect: Each player searches their deck. They may take a Lesson from their deck, reveal it, and put it into their hand. Each player shuffles their deck. Then you may put a Quidditch Lesson from your hand into play.

rulings.ruling: Your opponents do not need to take a Lesson from their deck. This is optional. They do, however, still need to shuffle their deck as they were required to search through it.

name: Quaffle
effect: When you play this card, search your deck. You may take a Match from your deck, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.

name: Quidditch Confidence
effect: Play this card only if there is a Match in play. Trade total progress toward winning a Match with an opponent. Then do 4 damage to that opponent.

rulings.ruling: Switching total progress towards a Match means that you and an opponent exchange totals of how close you are to winning a Match. This can include, but is not limited to: damage, number of Actions used to do X, or cards drawn.
You must switch progress if you play this card. Do everything on the card, in order. You cannot play this card just to do 4 damage.

name: Rooster
flavorText: '... the Basilisk flees only from the crowing of a rooster, which is fatal to it.'
effect: Slytherin's Basilisk cannot be played.

name: Sink Passageway
flavorText: 'It looked like an ordinary sink ... And then Harry saw it: Scratched on the side of one of the copper taps was a tiny snake.'
effect: Put a non-Healing Location from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Skele-Gro
effect: To play this card, discard 1 of your Potions Lessons from play. Choose 3 different non-Healing cards in your discard pile. Your opponent chooses 1 of those cards. Put that card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck in any order.

name: Slower Brooms
effect: All cards with a Power cost (yours and your opponents') need 1 more Power to play. If you play this card and you already have a Broom in play, discard the old one.

name: Substitute Cat
effect: Search your deck. You may take an Item or Creature with printed Power cost less than or equal to the number of Lessons you have in play, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.

rulings.ruling: Substitute Cat only counts the number of Lessons in play, not the amount of Power in play. This means Substitute Cat will not count Power provided from cards such as Wands, Books, or Professors.

name: Swish and Flick
flavorText: 'Now, don't forget that nice wrist movement we've been practicing!'  Professor Filius Flitwick
effect: Put a Lesson from your discard pile into play.

name: Wizard Duel
effect: Each player discards the top card of their deck. Do 8 damage to each player who discarded a card with the lowest printed Power cost. (Cards with no printed Power cost count as 0.)

rulings.ruling: If no card is discarded from the top of your deck, the printed Power cost is considered 0.

name: Godric Gryffindor
flavorText: By Gryffindor, the bravest were Prized far beyond the rest
effect: Whenever you draw your third card on your turn, you get 1 more Action that turn.

rulings.ruling: Godrics effect triggers only on the 3rd card you draw, not on every 3rd card in a turn.

name: Helga Hufflepuff
flavorText: For Hufflepuff, hard workers were Most worthy of admission
effect: Once during each of your turns, whenever one or more cards are put into your deck from play, your hand, or your discard pile, you get 1 more Action that turn.

name: Hogwarts: A History
effect: You may use an Action to discard a Lesson card from your hand. If you do, you may put a non-Healing card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Rowena Ravenclaw
flavorText: For Ravenclaw, the cleverest Would always be the best
effect: Once during each of your turns, whenever you play a card with printed Power cost 6 or more, you may put a Lesson card from your discard pile into play.

name: Salazar Slytherin
flavorText: Power-hungry Slytherin Loved those of great ambition.
effect: At the end of each of your turns, if you did damage to an opponent, you may reveal the top 2 cards of their deck. You may discard any number of them. Put the rest on the top of their deck in any order.

name: The Grand Staircase
effect: Before each player's turn, they get 1 fewer Action that turn. Once during each player's turn, they may discard a Lesson card from their hand to get 1 more Action.
note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or an opponent's).

name: Cockatrice Attack
effect: Your opponent's non-starting Characters have no abilities, damage each turn, health, or keywords (except Unique) while this card is in play.
to solve: Your opponent discards 2 Character cards from their hand.
reward: Your opponent chooses 1 of your cards in play and discards it.
toSolve: Your opponent discards 2 Character cards from their hand.
reward: Your opponent chooses 1 of your cards in play and discards it.

name: Hogwarts' First Match

prize: The winner may choose an opponent's card in play and discard it.
prize: The winner may choose an opponent's card in play and discard it.

name: Hogwarts Kitchens
effect: Before each player's turn, they may search their deck. They may take a Healing card, reveal it, and put it into their hand. Then they shuffle their deck.
note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or an opponent's).

name: Hufflepuff Common Room
effect: Before each players turn, they count the number of Hufflepuff cards they have in play. For every 2 they have in play (rounded up), they put up to 1 non-Healing card from their discard pile on the bottom of their deck and draw a card.
note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or an opponent's).

name: Ravenclaw Common Room
effect: Before each player's turn, they count the number of Ravenclaw cards they have in play. The first card they play that turn needs that much less Power to play. (You still need at least 1 Power that matches).
note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or an opponent's).

name: Stairs into Slides
flavorText: "Er  I dont think were allowed in the girls dormitories"' - Ron Weasley
effect: Choose an opponent's non-Lesson card in play they played during their last turn. Discard that card.

name: The First Triwizard Tournament
effect: Your opponent's non-Lesson cards that don't have a printed Power cost require 1 more Action to play.
to solve: Your opponent skips a total of 4 Actions.
reward: Your opponent gets 1 more Action (the turn this Adventure is solved).
toSolve: Your opponent skips a total of 4 Actions.
reward: Your opponent gets 1 more Action (the turn this Adventure is solved).

name: Animated Armour
effect: If this card is in your discard pile, you may discard a Lesson card from your hand to play this card as if it were in your hand.

name: Bewitched Ceiling
effect: Once during each of your turns, you may discard the the top card of your deck. If you do, until the end of the turn, this card provides 2 Power that matches the Lesson type of that card.

rulings.ruling: If Bewitched Ceiling leaves play, it no longer provides Power, even if it reenters play the same turn. If Bewitched Ceiling reenters play, you may use its effect again.
Lessons, Characters and Adventures do not have a Lesson type. If one of those is discarded, Bewitched Ceiling does not provide power.

name: Depulso
effect: Choose an opponent's card in play with a printed Power cost and put it on the bottom of its owner's deck.

rulings.ruling: Adventures, Characters, and Lessons have no printed Power cost, and thus cannot be chosen for this card.

name: Invisibility Potion
effect: If this card is in your discard pile, you may discard a Lesson card from your hand to play this card as if it were in your hand.  Choose an opponent. During their next turn, they cannot choose your cards in play.

name: Midnight Snacks
effect: Choose 5 non-Healing cards in your discard pile. Your opponent chooses 1 of them. Put that card into your hand and shuffle the rest into your deck.

name: Stooging Penalty
effect: Do 2 damage to an opponent. Then, if they have any Characters in play, they choose 1 of them and discard it.

name: Wild Cockatrice
effect: To play this card, discard 1 of your [F] Lessons from play. When you play this card, you may choose an opponent's Character in play (other than their starting Character) and discard it.

name: Alley Blast
flavorText: 'A crater in the middle of the street, so deep it had cracked the sewer below. Bodies everywhere. Muggles screaming.'  Cornelius Fudge
effect: Do 12 damage to an opponent.

name: Azkaban
flavorText: 'The fortress is set on a tiny island, way out to sea, but they dont need walls and water to keep the prisoners in ...'  Professor Remus Lupin
note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's).
effect: When you play this card, choose a non-Lesson card type. When any player uses an Action to play a card of the chosen type, they use 1 more Action to play that card.

name: Black's Break-In
effect: Reveal the top card of your deck. If it's a Character, you may put it into play. Otherwise, discard the revealed card. At the end of the turn, if the Character put into play by Black's Break In is still in play, discard it.

name: Buckbeak
flavorText: Buckbeak the hippogriff was lying in the corner, chomping on something that was oozing blood all over the floor.
effect: To play this card, discard 1 of your Care of Magical Creatures Lessons from play. Whenever an opponent plays a Creature, that Creature and Buckbeak do damage to each other.

rulings.ruling: Both Creatures do damage at the same time, and they deal damage only once.

name: Cornelius Fudge
flavorText: 'That's Dad's boss,' Ron breathed. 'The Minister of Magic!'
effect: Before each of your turns, you get 1 more Action for every Action each opponent used beyond their second on their last turn. You cant gain Actions from cards other than this card.

rulings.ruling: You get 1 extra Action for each Action your opponent uses beyond their second. (You get 1 extra Action if they used 1 extra Action; you get 2 extra Actions if they used 2 extra Actions; etc.)

name: Dementor
effect: When you play this card, you may discard 1 of your Lessons from play to choose an opponents Character in play (other than their starting Character) and put it on top of its owners deck. During that opponents next turn, they can't use Actions to play Characters.

name: Filch, Hogwarts Caretaker
flavorText: Filch was suddenly bustling up and down the corridors, boarding up everything from tiny cracks in the walls to mouse holes.
effect: You may use an Action to discard an Event from play.

rulings.ruling: You may use Filchs ability to discard one of your own Events from play.

name: Firebolt
effect: Once during each of your turns, when you use an Action to play a Quidditch card, you may look at the top 4 cards of your deck, put them on the top and/or bottom of your deck in any order, and then draw a card. ( When you play this card, discard the other Broom (s) you control.)

name: Fred & George, Beaters
flavorText: 'Weve got two unbeatable Beaters.  Oliver Wood
effect: Before each of your turns, if you have a Quidditch Item in play, do 2 damage to an opponent.

name: Harry, Young Marauder
flavorText: 'How extraordinarily like your father you are, Potter ... The resemblance between you is uncanny.'  Professor Severus Snape
effect: Once per game, you may search your deck. You may take an Event from your deck, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck. Until the end of your turn, Events do not require Power that matches their Lesson type to play.

name: Homework by Wandlight
flavorText: It was nearly midnight, and he was lying on his stomach in bed, the blankets drawn right over his head like a tent, a flashlight in one hand ...
note: Play this card only if you have at least 4 Lessons in play.
effect: Before each of your opponent's turns, you may choose one of their Lessons in play. Return it to its owner's hand.
to solve: Your opponent takes 10 damage.
reward: Until the end of their turn, your opponent may play 1 non-Healing card in their discard pile as if it were in their hand.
toSolve: Your opponent takes 10 damage.
reward: Until the end of their turn, your opponent may play 1 non-Healing card in their discard pile as if it were in their hand.

name: Knight Bus
effect: Search your deck. You may take a Wizard or Witch from your deck, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you have a Wand in play, you may put that card into play instead. Then shuffle your deck.

name: Nightly Practices
flavorText: He therefore increased the number of team practices to five a week.
effect: When you play a Beater, Chaser, Keeper, or Seeker, you may choose an opponent. If they have any cards in play, they choose 1 of them and discard it.

name: Professor Remus Lupin
effect: Once per turn, you may use an Action to choose an opponent's non-Lesson card in play and a card in their discard pile with the same name. Put both on the bottom of their deck. (You must choose 2 cards.)

name: Professor Rubeus Hagrid
flavorText: 'Yer in my firs ever lesson! Right after lunch! Bin up since five gettin everythin ready.'  Professor Rubeus Hagrid
effect: Once during each of your turns, when you discard 1 of your Care of Magical Creatures Lessons from play, you may draw a card and put 1 Lesson from your discard pile into your hand.

rulings.ruling: If you decide to draw a card, you must also be able to put 1 COMC Lesson from your discard pile into your hand. You cannot choose to do only 1 of these parts of the ability.

name: Professor Sybill Trelawney
flavorText: 'I have been crystal gazing  and to my astonishment, I saw myself abandoning my solitary luncheon and coming to join you. Who am I to refuse the promptings of fate?'  Professor Sybill Trelawney
effect: Before each of your turns, you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put them on the top and/or bottom of your deck in any order.

rulings.ruling: You may put both cards back on top, both cards on bottom, or 1 on top and 1 on bottom.

name: Secret-Keeper
effect: When the last card would leave your deck, discard this card from play instead. If you do, put any number of cards from your hand on the bottom of your deck in any order, and cards cannot leave your deck until the end of the turn. When you build your deck, you can put only 1 Secret-Keeper in it.   (This effect occurs during other card effects.)

rulings.ruling: If you would take damage (or draw cards, or discard cards from the top of your deck, or any other effect that causes cards to leave your deck), you will do so until you have only one card left in your deck, and then Secret-Keepers effect will activate.

After Secret-Keepers effect activates, card cannot leave your deck, meaning you cannot take damage, draw cards, or discard cards from your deck. Any card that would move cards in any way from your deck cannot be activated until the next turn.
If Secret-Keeper is activated on your turn, you cannot use an Action to draw a card.

This is a replacement effect for when you would lose the game by your last card leaving your deck for any reason. Because this is a replacement effect, it will trigger in the middle of other cards resolution that make you draw, discard, take damage, or make the last card leave your deck in any way. Once this effect triggers, stop doing any other cards effect, resolve this card entirely, and then finish resolving other cards. No cards may leave your deck until the next turn begins.

Regarding an interaction with Errol: You may reveal the top card of your deck, since revealing isnt a card leaving your deck. If it fulfills Errols condition of being a Lesson, and it is the last card in your deck, then Secret-Keepers ability triggers and Errol will be unable to put the Lesson into play. Otherwise, the card stays on top of your deck and Secret-Keeper will not trigger.

Regarding an interaction with Wizard Duel: If you have only one card left in your deck and Secret-Keeper is in play, Secret-Keeper will activate and prevent you from discarding the top card of your deck. Since you did not discard any card from the top of your deck, there is no printed Power cost, which Wizard Duel would then treat as 0. Then you will finish resolving Wizards Duel, which can do no damage to you since cards cannot leave your deck.

The specific part of the card effect that caused your last card to leave your deck is considered finished when Secret-Keepers ability triggers, but any other parts of the effect unrelated to that still resolve. (e.g. Blue Wig will still let you draw a card even if Secret-Keeper stops the damage when you have 1 card left in your deck.)

name: Sir Cadogan
flavorText: 'Come follow me, dear friends, and we shall find our goal, or else shall perish bravely in the charge!'  Sir Cadogan
effect: Once during each of your turns, when you play a card with an even printed Power cost, you may draw a card, and then you may put a Lesson from your hand into play.

rulings.ruling: Sir Cadogan sees printed Power cost, not Power cost. Sir Cadogan doesnt care if a card (such as Bravado) adjusts the Power of a card. As long as the number printed on the card is even, Sir Cadogan will trigger.

name: Sirius Black
flavorText: '. . . He was clever enough to escape from Azkaban, and thats supposed to be impossible.'  Arthur Weasley
effect: For every 3 different card types in your discard pile, your opponents' cards require 1 more Power to play.

rulings.ruling: Sirius Blacks effect only increases Power requirements to cards that require Power to play.
Cards with multiple card types count as each different card type they are (such as The Monster Book of Monsters counting as both an Item and a Creature).

name: Stan Shunpike

effect: Once per turn, you may use an Action to choose a Location in play and do damage to an opponent equal to its printed Power cost.

rulings.ruling: You may use any Location in play, even ones owned by your opponents.

name: 12 Years in Azkaban

effect: Whenever you take damage, prevent up to 2 of that damage. If this card has prevented at least 12 damage, it no longer prevents damage and instead Provides Potions.

rulings.ruling: This card prevents any type of damage.
If you have prevented 11 damage with this card, and take at least 2 damage, you may still prevent 2 of that damage. However, after that, it will no longer be able to prevent damage.

You will need to keep track of the damage this card prevents. The damage prevention is cumulative. When it prevents at least 12 damage, the card no longer prevents damage and instead provides Lesson power.
You may choose to prevent 0, 1, or 2 damage.

name: At the Three Broomsticks
effect: Whenever your opponent uses an Action to play a card, you may choose a non-Healing card from your discard pile and put it on the bottom of your deck.
to solve: Your opponent uses Actions to play cards 10 times.
reward: Your opponent may search their deck for a Spell, reveal it, put it into their hand, and then shuffle their deck.
toSolve: Your opponent uses Actions to play cards 10 times.
reward: Your opponent may search their deck for a Spell, reveal it, put it into their hand, and then shuffle their deck.

rulings.ruling: Each instance of playing a card, regardless of how many Actions are used to play the card, counts as 1 time of playing a card. This means you only heal 1 card, regardless of how many Actions were used to play a card. This also means your opponent will only have played a card 1 time even if they used 2 or more Actions to play a card.
If you would lose the game during the resolution of the cards effect, At the Three Broomsticks will not save you by adding another card to your deck.

name: Azkaban Breakout

toSolve: Your opponent skips a total of 4 Actions.
reward: Your opponent may discard a Match in play. Then they may put a Match from their discard pile into play.

to solve: Your opponent does damage to you 4 times.
reward: Your opponent gets 1 more Action (the turn this Adventure is solved).
toSolve: Your opponent does damage to you 4 times.
reward: Your opponent gets 1 more Action (the turn this Adventure is solved).

rulings.ruling: This card checks for total damage prevented. If the total is more than 3, no matter how many instances of 1 or 2 damage were prevented, this card will not return to your hand.

rulings.ruling: Any discarded card will go into the discard pile as part of the resolution of the effect that discards it. Once it is in the discard pile, other cards that move it elsewhere will try to activate their effects. With Chamber of Secrets in play, it will stop Hooch Watches Practice from returning a discarded Match to play.

rulings.ruling: You may reveal a card of either card type that shares a card type with the revealed card. For example, if you reveal The Monster Book of Monsters (that is both an Item and Creature) you may reveal any card from your hand that has either card type.
You only need to reveal 1 card with at least 1 matching card type. You do not need to reveal a card that matches each card type.

effect: The first time you take damage each turn, you take 3 less damage.

name: Imperius Curse
flavorText: ‘“Total control,” said Moody quietly as the spider balled itself up and began to roll over and over.’
effect: When you play this card, choose an opponent's Character in play (except their starter Character) and take control of it while this card is in play.

name: Lee's Tarantula
effect: When this card is put into your discard pile from anywhere, put a Spider not named Lee's Tarantula from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Living Room Explosion

name: Love Potion
effect: Prevent all damage done to you.  Before your turn, discard this card from play.

effect: The first time you play a Spell that does no damage during each of your turns, do 3 damage to an opponent.

effect: You may use an Action to put any number of cards from your hand under this card facedown. If you do, draw that many cards. You may play cards under this card as if they were in your hand.

name: Perfurmed Fire

effect: Each player chooses 3 of their non-Healing cards in play and puts them on top of their owner's deck in any order. (If they have less than 3 cards in play, they put all of them on the top of their deck.)

name: Poliakoff

effect: Whenever your opponent plays a Creature, you may do 1 damage to it.

name: Rita Skeeter

effect: Once per turn, you may use an Action to count the number of your other Unique cards in play. Do that much damage to an opponent.

name: Rita's Surveillance
effect: Choose an opponent's Character in play with a "Once per game" or "Once per turn" ability (even if that ability is already used). Use that ability without using any Actions.

name: Unicorn Foals
effect: Reveal the card you draw during your draw step. If it is a Lesson card, you get 1 more Action this turn.

name: Weatherby

effect: Once during each of your turns, you may play a card beginning with the same letter as a card an opponent played last turn without using any Actions.

name: Wiggenweld Potion
effect: You may use an Action and discard this card from play to shuffle up to 13 non-Healing cards from your discard pile into your deck.

name: World Cup Tickets
effect: Play this card only if there is not a Match in play.  Search your deck. You may take a Quidditch Match from your deck and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.

name: A Guide to Advanced Transfiguration
effect: Before your turn, you may dicard this card from play. If you do, choose an opponent's card in play that did damage last turn. Discard that card from play.

name: Banned Item List
effect: Your opponents' cards with a printed Power cost need 1 more Power to play.

name: Blackboard Ingredients

effect: Search your deck. You may take up to 3 different Ingredient cards, reveal them, put them in your hand, and then shuffle your deck.

name: Blast-Ended Skrewts

effect: When you play this card, do 3 damage to 1 of your Creatures in play.

effect: Whenever you win a Match by completing it's "To Win," you get 1 more Action this turn.

name: Electric Fireplace

effect: To play this card, discard 1 of your [P] Lessons from play. Search your deck for a Wizard or Witch card and put it into play.

effect: Your [F] Lessons provide [F][F] instead of [F]. At the end of each of your turns, if you played another non-Lesson card, discard this card or 1 of your [F] Lessons from play.

effect: Whenever a card does damage, it does 2 less damage.

effect: When you play this card or any player plays a Character, you may choose an opponent. They discard a card from their hand.

toSolve: Your opponent chooses 4 Event cards in their hand and discards them.
reward: Your opponent may put a non-Healing Character card from their discard pile into their hand.

reward: Your opponent may put a Lesson from their discard pile into play.
toSolve: Your opponent discards their hand.
reward: Your opponent may put a Lesson from their discard pile into play.

reward: Your opponent may choose 1 of your cards in play and discard it.
toSolve: Your opponent skips a total of 5 Actions.
reward: Your opponent may choose 1 of your cards in play and discard it.

effect: Players cannot search their decks.
note: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or an opponent's).

effect: When you play this card or an opponent draws a card other than during their draw step, you may draw a card.

effect: When you play this card, you may put up to 2 non-Healing cards from your discard pile on the bottom of your deck in any order.

effect: Choose an opponent. During their next turn, they get 1 fewer Action and they can't draw cards except during their draw step.
